intro: Oreocarya holoptera, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada brome, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet, which is usually tightly compacted. Oreocarya holoptera plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native environment and is adapted to cold, arid conditions.
